impact_weight: The reduction of pesticides can aid in the protection and conservation of biodiversity by minimizing harm to species and ecosystems.
Reducing pesticide use can help restore and maintain healthy agricultural ecosystems, promoting biodiversity and ecosystem services.
Promoting competitive agriculture can create conditions for the restoration of agricultural ecosystems by encouraging sustainable practices and efficient resource use.
Competitive agriculture can contribute to biodiversity conservation by adopting practices that minimize environmental impact and promote ecosystem services.
Protecting workers' rights and promoting social security can help preserve urban natural areas by reducing the pressure on these areas from human activities.
Ensuring food affordability can contribute to biodiversity conservation by reducing the demand for resource-intensive food production and promoting sustainable consumption patterns.
Promoting healthy and sustainable food options can aid in biodiversity conservation by reducing the environmental impact of food production and promoting ecosystem services.
Improving animal welfare in food production can contribute to the conservation of fish stocks and marine ecosystems by promoting sustainable fishing and aquaculture practices.
